message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The study described is a randomized controlled trial, as subjects were randomly assigned to treatment with either captopril or valsartan and followed for a specific period of time with a primary endpoint of death from any cause. Cohort studies follow a specific group of individuals over time, case-control studies compare individuals with a specific outcome to those without, and crossover studies involve subjects receiving different treatments in a specific order.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the study, including random assignment of subjects, follow-up period, and comparison of outcomes, indicates that it is a randomized controlled trial.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The study design of the VALIANT trial is a randomized controlled trial, where subjects were randomly assigned to two different treatments and then followed for a certain period of time to observe outcomes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The study described is a randomized controlled trial, as subjects were randomly assigned to different treatments and followed for a specific endpoint.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The study is a randomized controlled trial as subjects were randomly assigned to treatment with either captopril or valsartan, and the effects on mortality were compared. Cohort studies compare the incidence of an outcome in a group of exposed individuals versus a group of non-exposed individuals, while case-control studies compare the odds of exposure in individuals with a certain outcome versus those without the outcome. Crossover studies involve each participant receiving different treatments at different time periods.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. This study is a randomized controlled trial, as subjects were randomly assigned to treatment with captopril or valsartan and then followed for a specified period of time to compare the efficacy of the two treatments.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the study matches that of a randomized controlled trial, in which subjects were randomly assigned to treatment with either captopril or valsartan and subsequently followed for a specific period with a primary endpoint of death from any cause.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medical research for help. This study is a randomized controlled trial since subjects were randomly assigned to treatment with either captopril or valsartan and followed for a specified period of time. The primary endpoint was also defined and measured.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The study described is a randomized controlled trial, as subjects were randomly assigned to receive either captopril or valsartan and followed for a specific period of time to compare the outcome of each treatment. Cohort studies generally observe a group of individuals over time without randomization, case-control studies compare individuals with and without a certain condition, and crossover studies involve subjects receiving both treatments in a randomized order.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. This is a randomized controlled trial since patients were randomly assigned to treatment groups and followed for a specified period of time to assess the primary endpoint. Cohort studies observe a group over time, case-control studies compare those with a condition to those without, and crossover studies involve switching the order of treatments in the same patient.
